definitions: showing a difficult, argumentative, and uncooperative nature often with irritability
examples: The cantankerous old neighbor complained about every little noise
My cantankerous uncle always finds something to argue about at dinner

definitions: positioned or placed at an angle rather than straight or level
examples: The canted roof allowed rain to run off easily
The picture frame looked canted against the crooked wall

definitions: relating to the smallest blood vessels that connect arteries and veins
having a very small diameter like a hair or thread
examples: The nurse examined the patient's capillary refill time
Capillary blood samples are often taken from fingertips
The capillary tubes were used for precise liquid measurements
Water moved through the soil's capillary spaces between particles

definitions: relating to or supporting an economic system based on private ownership and profit
examples: The capitalist economy encouraged entrepreneurship and competition
Many capitalist countries have mixed economies with some regulation

definitions: showing or having the characteristics of capitalism with emphasis on profit and private ownership
examples: Their capitalistic approach to healthcare raised ethical concerns
The company's capitalistic mindset prioritized profits over employee welfare

definitions: covered or closed with a cap or lid at the top
having a maximum limit that cannot be exceeded in amount or extent
examples: The capped bottle prevented any liquid from spilling out
Snow capped mountains dominated the scenic landscape view
Interest rates were capped at five percent by the government
The insurance policy had capped coverage for certain medical procedures

definitions: given to sudden and unaccountable changes of mood or behavior without apparent reason
examples: The capricious weather made planning outdoor events quite difficult
Her capricious decisions frustrated everyone trying to work with her

definitions: having one's attention or interest held completely by something charming or attractive
examples: The audience sat captivated by the magician's incredible performance
She was captivated by the beautiful sunset over the ocean

definitions: capable of attracting and holding interest or attention through charm or beauty
examples: Her captivating smile lit up the entire crowded room
The documentary told a captivating story of human resilience

definitions: kept in confinement or under restraint unable to escape
having no freedom to leave or choose alternatives in a situation
examples: The captive animals were kept in small enclosures at the zoo
Prisoners remained captive until their sentences were fully served
The delayed passengers were a captive audience for airport advertisements
Students were a captive market for overpriced campus bookstore textbooks

definitions: having a light golden brown color like that of heated sugar
examples: She chose caramel highlights to complement her dark brown hair
The leather couch came in a rich caramel shade

definitions: containing dissolved carbon dioxide gas that creates bubbles and fizz
examples: The carbonated drinks fizzed when we opened the bottles
Many people prefer carbonated water to still water with meals

definitions: having the potential to cause cancer in living tissue through exposure
examples: Tobacco smoke contains many carcinogenic chemicals harmful to health
The factory was shut down for using carcinogenic materials

definitions: lacking depth, emotion, or authenticity like a flat piece of cardboard
examples: The actor's cardboard performance failed to convince the audience
The novel's cardboard characters lacked any real personality development

definitions: relating to or affecting the heart and its functions
examples: The patient underwent cardiac surgery to repair damaged valves
Regular exercise helps maintain good cardiac health throughout life

definitions: of the greatest importance serving as an essential foundation or principle
having a deep scarlet red color like a cardinal bird
examples: Honesty is a cardinal virtue in building trust between people
The cardinal rule of first aid is to ensure your own safety
She wore a cardinal red dress to the holiday party
The cardinal flowers bloomed brilliantly in the summer garden

meanings: relating to heart and blood vessels
definitions: relating to or affecting the heart and blood vessels as a connected system
examples: Regular cardiovascular exercise improves overall health and endurance significantly
The doctor specializes in treating cardiovascular diseases like heart attacks

definitions: free from anxiety or responsibility with a happy untroubled attitude
examples: The children enjoyed carefree summer days playing by the lake
She missed her carefree college years before adult responsibilities arrived

definitions: not giving sufficient attention or thought to avoiding harm or errors
showing no interest or concern about consequences or others' feelings
examples: His careless driving nearly caused a serious accident yesterday
A careless mistake in the calculations cost the company thousands
She made a careless remark that hurt her friend's feelings
The careless disposal of waste damaged the local environment significantly

definitions: displaying kindness and concern for others with compassion and thoughtfulness
examples: The caring nurse stayed late to comfort the worried patient
Her caring nature made her an excellent elementary school teacher

definitions: having a vivid crimson red color with slight purplish tinge
examples: The artist mixed carmine paint for the dramatic sunset scene
Her carmine lipstick made a bold statement at the gala

definitions: relating to physical and especially sexual needs and activities of the body
examples: The novel explored the conflict between spiritual and carnal desires
Some religions view carnal pleasures as obstacles to enlightenment

definitions: feeding on animal flesh as the primary or sole food source
examples: Lions are carnivorous animals that hunt prey on the savanna
The carnivorous plants trap and digest insects for nutrients

definitions: having floors covered with carpet material for comfort and decoration
examples: The carpeted stairs muffled our footsteps as we climbed
They preferred carpeted bedrooms for warmth during cold winters

definitions: shaped or decorated by cutting away material to create designs or forms
examples: The carved wooden statue displayed incredible artistic detail throughout
Ancient carved symbols on the stone revealed historical messages

definitions: enclosed or covered in a protective case or outer covering
examples: The cased instruments were safe during the rough transportation
All the cased books survived the library flood without damage

definitions: having been converted from a check or similar instrument into money
examples: The cashed check appeared on her bank statement immediately
All cashed vouchers must be filed for accounting purposes

definitions: having had the reproductive organs surgically removed or made non-functional
examples: The castrated bull was calmer and easier to handle
Castrated male cats are less likely to roam or spray

definitions: causing sudden and violent upheaval or disaster on a large scale
examples: The asteroid impact had cataclysmic effects on Earth's climate
Their divorce was cataclysmic for the entire extended family

definitions: relating to the Protestant theological system of John Calvin emphasizing predestination
examples: The calvinist church stressed the doctrine of divine sovereignty
His calvinist upbringing influenced his views on work and success

definitions: showing or characterized by the strict religious principles of Calvinism
examples: Her calvinistic work ethic drove her to constant self-improvement
The community's calvinistic values emphasized discipline and moral purity

definitions: relating to the geological period 541-485 million years ago marked by diverse life
examples: Cambrian fossils show the explosion of complex life forms
The cambrian rock layers contained many trilobite specimens

definitions: relating to the Roman Catholic religious order founded on Mount Carmel
examples: The carmelite monastery maintained strict rules of contemplative prayer
She wore the traditional brown carmelite habit during services

definitions: relating to the Frankish dynasty founded by Charlemagne in medieval Europe
examples: The carolingian renaissance revived learning in medieval Europe
Carolingian minuscule became the standard script for copying texts

definitions: relating to the French philosopher Descartes or his methods and philosophy
examples: The cartesian coordinate system uses perpendicular axes for graphing
His cartesian approach separated mind and body as distinct substances

definitions: relating to the contemplative monastic order founded by Saint Bruno
examples: The carthusian monks lived in individual cells for solitary prayer
Their carthusian lifestyle emphasized silence and minimal human contact

definitions: belonging to the white or light-skinned racial grouping of humankind
relating to the Caucasus region between the Black and Caspian seas
examples: The study included participants of caucasian and Asian descent
The census form listed caucasian as one racial category option
Caucasian languages include Georgian, Armenian, and many others
The caucasian mountain range creates a natural barrier between regions

definitions: relating to the Celts or their languages, cultures, and traditions
examples: Celtic music features traditional instruments like harps and bagpipes
The celtic knot designs symbolized eternity with no beginning or end

definitions: relating to the current geological era beginning 66 million years ago
examples: Cenozoic fossils include many mammals and flowering plants
The cenozoic era saw the rise of human evolution

definitions: involving or causing sudden great damage, suffering, or complete failure
examples: The catastrophic earthquake destroyed thousands of homes within minutes
A catastrophic error in judgment led to the company's bankruptcy

definitions: capable of being transmitted from one person to another through contact
having the quality of attracting and holding attention or interest
examples: The doctor warned that the flu was highly catching this season
Her cold seemed catching as everyone in the office got sick
The song had a catching melody that stayed in your head
His catching enthusiasm motivated the entire team to work harder

definitions: having a pleasing quality that attracts attention and is easily remembered
examples: The advertisement used a catchy jingle to promote the product
She wrote catchy headlines that made people want to read more

definitions: stated in a clear and unqualified way leaving no doubt or exception
examples: She made a categorical denial of all the accusations against her
The scientist's categorical statement left no room for interpretation

definitions: organized or arranged into classes or groups based on shared characteristics
examples: The library books were categorised by subject and reading level
All emails were categorised into folders for easy retrieval

definitions: organized or arranged into classes or groups based on shared characteristics
examples: The products were categorized by price range and quality
Scientists categorized the specimens according to their genetic traits

definitions: providing psychological relief through the expression of strong emotions
examples: Writing in her journal was a cathartic experience after the breakup
The intense movie provided a cathartic release for viewers

definitions: relating to or acting as a cause of something else
examples: Scientists studied the causal relationship between smoking and cancer
The report examined causal factors leading to the accident

definitions: acting as or expressing a cause that makes something happen
examples: Researchers identified the causative agent of the disease outbreak
The causative factors of poverty are complex and interconnected

definitions: capable of burning or corroding organic tissue through chemical action
expressing harsh, bitter criticism in a way that hurts feelings
examples: The caustic chemical burned through the metal container quickly
Workers wore protective gear when handling caustic cleaning solutions
His caustic remarks about her work left her feeling humiliated
The critic's caustic review destroyed the playwright's reputation

definitions: serving as a warning about potential danger or undesirable consequences
examples: The cautionary tale taught children about the dangers of lying
Road signs displayed cautionary messages about icy conditions ahead
